aruco-tracker.title: ArUco Token Tracker
aruco-tracker.description: Integrates physical ArUco marker tracking with Foundry VTT tokens for hybrid tabletop gaming

trackerHost.name: ArUco Tracker Host
trackerHost.hint: IP address or hostname of the ArUco tracker device (Raspberry Pi or computer running the tracking software)

websocketPort.name: WebSocket Port
websocketPort.hint: Port number for WebSocket connection to the ArUco tracker (default: 30001)

autoCreateTokens.name: Auto-Create Tokens
autoCreateTokens.hint: Automatically create new tokens when ArUco markers are detected for the first time

tokenImagePath.name: Default Token Image
tokenImagePath.hint: Default image path for auto-created tokens when no specific type is detected

playerTokenImage.name: Player Token Image
playerTokenImage.hint: Specific image path for player tokens (ArUco marker IDs 10-25)

itemTokenImage.name: Item Token Image
itemTokenImage.hint: Specific image path for item/NPC tokens (ArUco marker IDs 30-61)

enableCORS.name: Enable CORS Headers
enableCORS.hint: Add Cross-Origin Resource Sharing headers for requests from the tracking device

updateThrottle.name: Update Throttle (ms)
updateThrottle.hint: Minimum time in milliseconds between position updates to prevent excessive network traffic

confidenceThreshold.name: Confidence Threshold
confidenceThreshold.hint: Minimum detection confidence (0.0-1.0) required to accept marker position updates

optimization.title: Optimization Benefits
benefits: ✓ Better for tabletop gaming use cases

steps: Ensure ArUco tracker is running on {host}
Check that port {port} is open and accessible
Verify network connectivity between Foundry and tracker
Check firewall settings on both machines
Make sure ArUco markers are properly generated and printed
Ensure adequate lighting for marker detection
Verify marker orientation and surface flatness

quickStart.title: Quick Start Guide
steps: 1. Print ArUco markers (IDs 0-3 for corners, 10+ for tokens)
2. Set up camera above play area with good lighting
3. Place corner markers (IDs 0-3) at table boundaries
4. Configure tracker host IP in module settings
5. Test connection using the status dialog
6. Place token markers and watch them appear in Foundry!
